body.p: To protect the system from getting overloaded, different overload protection measurements are taken. Kafka input stream and Reprocessor stream stop collecting data if the database is running out of storage space, or if one of the consecutive streams, Business logic stream or Output stream, can not process the data in the same speed as it is collected. Output stream has a similar protection in place, where CG Collector Node stops collecting output records if the consecutive nodes in the stream are not able to process the records fast enough.

Kafka input stream also monitors the number of uncollected messages in the Kafka topic (called consumer lag in Kafka terminology). When the number reaches the configured thresholds, UI notifications are generated to advise the administrator to scale out the solution.
